intro: Tetraptera parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered tetraptera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Tetraptera parviflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
